New Records: Jayson Tatum scored 16 points in the first quarter, marking the third time he has reached that number in an opening frame in eight games this season. No other player in the league has done so more than once.
Tatum has 106 first-quarter points on the campaign, which is 44 points more than the next-closest player on the leaderboard, Anthony Davis.
Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum erupted for 26 points in the first half, guiding Boston to a 22-point advantage at the break.
Boston's lead expanded to as many as 37 points in the second half before finishing with a 123-93 win.
Tatum opened the game with a running dunk and knocked down 4-of-6 from 3-point range during the first quarter.
Tatum handed out five of his nine assists during the third quarter.
Derrick White finished as the game’s second-leading scorer and assister behind Tatum with 21 points and six assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum mentioned he is trying to start the game off more aggressively compared to earlier years.
Tatum and Derrick White have a tradition of wearing headbands in unison if one of them feels like having a headband game.
